001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.adapter;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.ViewGroup;
006import androidx.annotation.ColorInt;
007import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
008import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
009import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter;
010import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder;
011import com.google.android.material.color.MaterialColors;
012import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.R;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.databinding.ItemLocationResultsBinding;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.model.entity.Location;
015import java.util.List;
016
017/**
018 * This adapter formats the fields in the Location entity for a recycler view in
019 * the Location Fragment
020 */
021public class LocationsAdapter extends Adapter<ViewHolder> {
022
023  private final LayoutInflater inflater;
024  private final String coordinateFormat;
025  private final List<Location> locations;
026  @ColorInt
027  private final int secureRowBackground;
028  @ColorInt
029  private final int unsecureRowBackground;
030
031  /**
032   * This constructor takes a context and a list of locations as parameters and defines
033   * three fields for formatting.
034   * @param context
035   * @param locations
036   */
037  public LocationsAdapter(Context context, List<Location> locations) {
038    this.locations = locations;
039    inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
040    coordinateFormat = context.getString(R.string.coordinate_format);
041    secureRowBackground = MaterialColors.getColor(context, R.attr.secureRowBackground, 0);
042    unsecureRowBackground = MaterialColors.getColor(context, R.attr.unsecureRowBackground, 0);
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * The onCreateViewHolder method creates all of the holders for the recycler view
047   * @param viewGroup
048   * @param type
049   * @return
050   */
051  @NonNull
052  @Override
053  public ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup viewGroup, int type) {
054    return new Holder(
055        ItemLocationResultsBinding.inflate(inflater, viewGroup, false),
056        coordinateFormat, secureRowBackground, unsecureRowBackground);
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * The onBindViewHolder method binds the individual holders and creates more as is
061   * needed to fill the view.
062   * @param holder
063   * @param position
064   */
065  @Override
066  public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull ViewHolder holder, int position) {
067    ((Holder) holder).bind(position, locations.get(position));
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * getItemCount generates a value of the total number of entries in the Location entity
072   * @return
073   */
074  @Override
075  public int getItemCount() {
076    return locations.size();
077  }
078
079  private static class Holder extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder {
080
081    private final ItemLocationResultsBinding binding;
082    private final String coordinateFormat;
083    @ColorInt
084    private final int secureRowBackground;
085    @ColorInt
086    private final int unsecureRowBackground;
087
088    Holder(ItemLocationResultsBinding binding, String coordinateFormat,
089        int secureRowBackground, int unsecureRowBackground) {
090      super(binding.getRoot());
091      this.binding = binding;
092      this.coordinateFormat = coordinateFormat;
093      this.secureRowBackground = secureRowBackground;
094      this.unsecureRowBackground = unsecureRowBackground;
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * The onBindViewHolder method binds the individual fields from the Location entity
099     * into fields in the holder
100     * @param position
101     * @param location
102     */
103    public void bind(int position, Location location) {
104      binding.getRoot().setBackgroundColor((location.isSecure()) ? secureRowBackground : unsecureRowBackground);
105      binding.latitude.setText(String.format(coordinateFormat, location.getGpsCoord().latitude()));
106      binding.longitude.setText(String.format(coordinateFormat, location.getGpsCoord().longitude()));
107      binding.isSecure.setText(String.valueOf(location.isSecure()));
108    }
109  }
110
111}
